_header: Til his disciples said Jesu Christ / as says Saint John
Note: For the version in the ‘expanded’ Cycle see 5981.
_description: Gospel, ‘Dominica infra Octave Ascensionis’, in the Northern Homily Cycle

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
TO his disciples seide cristAs seiþ seint Ion þe
                    Ewangelist…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…ffor whon he þenkeþ on his endyngGrede of deþ
                    slakeþ his lykyng
BodEngPoeta1.Attributed Title:
In die sancte trinitatis / Cum venit paraclitus quem ego (f.
                        195va)
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodAsh42.First Lines:
UNto his dissipils saide cristeAls saise saynte Iohan þe
                    euangeliste…
BodAsh42.Last Lines:
…ffor when he thinkis of his endingeþe drede of dede
                    slakis his likinge
BodAsh42.Editions:
Thompson,  Anne B.,
                        ed.  
             The Northern Homily
                    Cycle.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008.

MinULZ822.First Lines:
Tyll hys disciplis sayd crysteals says saynt Ion þe
                    euangelyste…
MinULZ822.Last Lines:
…ffor when he thynkes on hys endyngdowte of ded sclaes hys
                    lykyng
MinULZ822.Attributed Title:
In octavis ascencionis euangelium Recumbentibus Secundum Iohannem
                    (f. 95)

HunHM129.First Lines:
To his dysciplys sayd cristAs sayth seint Ion þe
                    wangelyst…
HunHM129.Last Lines:
…ffor worldys welth euer myngyt isWith sum wo and
                    byttyrnysffor is no emperoure ne kyngeþat he ne is sumwhyle in
                    murnyngeffor when he þynkyth on his endyngeffor doute off deth
                    sleyth hys lykynge
HunHM129.Note:
This MS ends four lines earlier, with last four lines above treated as
                    first four of 644.
